This setting is referenced in documentation as being public on the global
config but it never actually was.

Fixes #1573.

commit.message:
core: consolidate fork checks (#1533)

We are required to check whether or not a process has forked for the runtime-id
as well as for the PRNG. Both of these are required to be done before a new
span is generated which we were formerly doing independently.

It makes sense to consolidate these checks both for efficiency as well as
maintainability, which is what this patch does.

verification.payload:
tree 5ed8099b02d5bad0f4e65e082d110e1a00b77456
parent f94459ffaa3e1ef28dc8d2d26e0e675fe23c19dc
author Kyle Verhoog <kyle@verhoog.ca> 1597200987 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1597200987 -0400

core: consolidate fork checks (#1533)

We are required to check whether or not a process has forked for the runtime-id
as well as for the PRNG. Both of these are required to be done before a new
span is generated which we were formerly doing independently.

It makes sense to consolidate these checks both for efficiency as well as
maintainability, which is what this patch does.

commit.message:
tests: move 'unit' and 'internal' suites into tracer module (#1606)

There wasn't a good reason to keep these separate and it resulted in scattering tests about different locations.

* move unit tests to tests/tracer

* move tests/util -> tests/__init__.py

* remove duplicate test module

* move tests/internal -> tests/tracer

commit.message:
ci: remove verify_all_tests_ran job (#1604)

* ci: remove verify_all_tests_ran job

This job, while useful for synchronization, isn't actually necessary for
our CI pipeline.

Its functionality of verifying that the tests ran is redundant since we
use a helper run_tox_scenario to guarantee that all test cases are run.

* Keep deploys synchronous

verification.payload:
tree fc929582b15e81fccef32001d8a1fafbb5b3d2d2
parent 4be09deb8ef836facf641dcd02d4e070d0bf7b81

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1597159792 -0400

This job, while useful for synchronization, isn't actually necessary for

commit.message:
build: use release-branch-semver versioning in setuptool-scm (#1595)

That makes sure that when the last tag on `master` is 0.39, then the next
version for master is 0.40(.devN).
On the other hand, when on a branch named 0.39, the next version will be
0.39.1(.devN).

Co-authored-by: Tahir H. Butt <tahir.butt@datadoghq.com>

verification.payload:
tree 0cc75abfa8e897ba10ac9cd97b2a2f7739f7ae09
parent 1c153a5b18c5d6bacfd8a43a3507924692d99e78
author Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info> 1597065799 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1597065799 -0400

build: use release-branch-semver versioning in setuptool-scm (#1595)

That makes sure that when the last tag on `master` is 0.39, then the next
version for master is 0.40(.devN).
On the other hand, when on a branch named 0.39, the next version will be
0.39.1(.devN).

Co-authored-by: Tahir H. Butt <tahir.butt@datadoghq.com>

commit.message:
ci: add deploy workflow (#1594)

This patch adds a deploy workflow for automatically deploying the package to PYPI when a release is "published".

According to the docs for "published":

> published: a release, pre-release, or draft of a release is published

[source](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#release)

Unfortunately Github actions [doesn't have a manual approval step](https://github.community/t/github-actions-manual-trigger-approvals/16233/85) which would be ideal to use here.

This is based off of the [cibuildwheel example](https://github.com/joerick/cibuildwheel/blob/5c4767899dc4418b509a2d7ccfde07d33ab29e28/examples/github-deploy.yml) and our modifications made in #1554.

Co-authored-by: Brett Langdon <brett.langdon@datadoghq.com>

verification.payload:
tree 0d39c6811b506a63d8355499d33cf95e6f1b454a
parent 9195ac4d8e1ee7c377477ded068d377dc6d7875d
author Kyle Verhoog <kyle@verhoog.ca> 1596658743 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1596658743 -0400

ci: add deploy workflow (#1594)

This patch adds a deploy workflow for automatically deploying the package to PYPI when a release is "published".

According to the docs for "published":

> published: a release, pre-release, or draft of a release is published

[source](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#release)

Unfortunately Github actions [doesn't have a manual approval step](https://github.community/t/github-actions-manual-trigger-approvals/16233/85) which would be ideal to use here.

This is based off of the [cibuildwheel example](https://github.com/joerick/cibuildwheel/blob/5c4767899dc4418b509a2d7ccfde07d33ab29e28/examples/github-deploy.yml) and our modifications made in #1554.

Co-authored-by: Brett Langdon <brett.langdon@datadoghq.com>

commit.message:
requests_gevent: run import dependent tests to separate process (#1588)

This test formerly depended on ddtrace not being imported which isn't
ideal since our test suite depends on it. This change enables us to not
have to worry about imports.

verification.payload:
tree 95e2122578d171f77940366bdc3a77dfcbd517ee
parent 5ad8851fcfe04a8decb4e061ec9e262e75c88b9c
author Kyle Verhoog <kyle@verhoog.ca> 1596506023 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1596506023 -0400

requests_gevent: run import dependent tests to separate process (#1588)

This test formerly depended on ddtrace not being imported which isn't
ideal since our test suite depends on it. This change enables us to not
have to worry about imports.
